timeline.bodyText: @sima-zhu  how did you find these links? I wouldn't have expected them to be flagged by our checks as they aren't real links from an html prospective.
timeline.author: weshaggard
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -81,7 +81,7 @@ Both the asynchronous and synchronous Event Hub producer and consumer clients ca
 
 The snippet below creates a synchronous Event Hub producer.
 
-<!-- embedme ./src/samples/java/com/azure/messaging/eventhubs/ReadmeSamples.java#L31-L35 -->
+<!-- embedme https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/eventhubs/azure-messaging-eventhubs/src/samples/java/com/azure/messaging/eventhubs/ReadmeSamples.java#L31-L35 -->

replies.bodyText: This is where we do match and replace. Will fix it.
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: Lets not modify this eng/common file but instead explicitly pass true where we use it in the java repo.
timeline.author: weshaggard
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -4,7 +4,7 @@ parameters:
   WorkingDirectory: '$(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)'
   ScriptDirectory: 'eng/common/scripts'
   Recursive: $false
-  CheckLinkGuidance: $false
+  CheckLinkGuidance: $true

timeline.bodyText: I suspect this might also need to be set for the aggregate-reports pipeline.
timeline.author: weshaggard
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -164,6 +157,7 @@ jobs:
       - template: ../../../common/pipelines/templates/steps/verify-links.yml
         parameters:
           Directory: sdk/${{ parameters.ServiceDirectory }}
+          CheckLinkGuidance: $true

replies.bodyText: I did not enable aggregate-report yml. Will trigger the aggregate-report again once I check in the changes.
replies.author: sima-zhu

replies.bodyText: I'm Ok with that as long as you quickly follow-up on any broken links as I want to make sure we don't accidently break any pipelines.
replies.author: weshaggard

replies.bodyText: I plan to work on lang repos subsequently as work altogether will cause a spike unfortunately.
replies.author: sima-zhu
